Description: Foot and wall fragment of East Greek pottery bowl. Interior: tondo with a lotus and bud frieze framed by thinned glaze lines; glazed to the outside with an added red band. On the slipped exterior, a lotus and bud festoon framed by added red bands at the base, and a maeander frieze above; added red on the lotuses and buds, inside and out. Disc and circles under the foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 27, no. 92 pl. 26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.155)
